intro: Anemopaegma subundulatum, commonly known as the undulating anemone, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically elongated and have a wavy or undulating edge, giving it its common name. Anemopaegma subundulatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
